title: Kind and caring staff - fantastic experience!
body: My son accompanied me to a pre-assessment and fortunately the laser procedure was available the next day. On both occasions, we found all staff to be outstanding in politeness, assistance and enthusiasm. From the gentleman who looks after check-in and offers to get refreshments, to the optometrist who treats patients with care and compassion - amazing. As a NHS facility, it's one of the most efficient and effective that I have experienced.

title: The Royal Free Hospital's Maternity Services
body:
This was our first baby therefore we were nervous however we always felt looked after by nurses and midwifes from beginning to end. Even though it wasn`t unusual to go past due date with the first child we didn`t want to wait long and didn`t want to have induction and the hospital let us have C-Section. 
I really appreciate all the hard work they`re putting into supporting pregnant women and husbands and I`ll be always grateful to all staff of labour ward, midwifes, doctors, breastfeed consultants, pediatrician and anaesthetists.
Thank you for this extraordinary experience.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful staff
body: I attended A&E a few days ago with my child, which is unfortunately a fairly regular occurrence, and as usual, the staff has been absolutely wonderful. Although an A&E visit is never a quick thing, everyone is working so hard and still remains friendly and helpful. On this occasion one of the Health Care Assistants was especially great and was so good with my little one. As so far we have always had such good experiences in the paediatric A&E , I just wanted to say a big thank you to all the staff, you are just wonderful.

title: Good so far
body: Registered at this surgery due to my old one being impossible to get an appointment with and being unhelpful and so far so good! The team seem friendly and the e consultation service seems to be good!

title: Great Experience
body: Visited today with suspected broken ankle. Expected to be hours but was moved swiftly through to minor injuries from a&e, sent for xray and then back to see doctor and was out of the hospital within 1 and a half hours with confirmation I had broke a bone and how to treat it. Staff were all lovely and really helpful. Couldn't fault anything.

title: Friendly efficient service
body: Unfortunately I had to attend the Minor injuries unit in Warwick Hospital after a bad fall. I was seen by a nurse, doctor, radiographer and clinical technician who were all consistently friendly efficient and professional. I am extremely grateful for their help and impressed by how quickly I was dealt with.

title: Excellent GP
body: I met a GP at the Priory Medical Group North Shields on 12 January 2023 at 11:00am to discuss some health issues. GP's pleasant and welcoming manner made me feel both comfortable and valued as a patient. She listened with care, answered all my questions with patience and provided excellent advice. GP,s empathetic approach and kind manner  helped me get through a rather difficult day with a smile on my face. Please pass on my thank you to the GP. Thanks.

title: Waiting time/ service standards
body:
Arrived 10.30 being sick continuously and vomiting non stop. Took good six hours to be checked by a doctor. Have to keep reminding nurses after doctor told us that will be given fluids through IV. Finaly after a little digging with one of the nurses they realised that we're waiting for fluids before we are sent home. Felt like if i was not there reminding them they will leave it for morning shift to pick up the pieces . Its 5.36 am right now and just given the fluids through IV. First treatment since arriving at 10.30 pm.

I appreciate that its Saturday and a busy shift for staff but someone visibly in distress because of sickness/vomiting non stop should be given some empathy.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Ideal practice
body: I always get the service and attention I need. The receptionists are helpful and the doctors unfailingly attentive, kind and helpful.

title: Unrealistic wait times given.
body: I was told by the nurse a doctor will call ne within the next 6 hours I stayed awake until 1am to find no phone call made to me and am still waiting for a phone call 12 hours later

title: Endoscopy Day Centre - great care
body:
had a procedure at Endoscopy day centre  and cant fault the staff and process from arrival to leaving. All the staff are friendly, cheerful, respectful. I felt very at ease in what is a daunting procedure. I have this procedure every year and Ive never had anything but good care.
thank you all .

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Thank you
body:
I know surgeries get a lot of negative reviews for queue times for appointments and not having appointments available, which I understand and you cannot help the amount of people who call on any given day!

I have had trouble getting through, but when I do I have alway been listened to and treated appropriately every single time.

I love that you offer phone appointments as it is just easier than having to go into surgery and when I did need to go in face to face urgently it was done asap on the day.

Thank you all for what you do!

title: Efficient and friendly practice
body: As soon as test results were in I was asked to see my GP about them, but it was easy to get the precise results myself by phoning and asking for them. The consultation was constructive; the GP gave me plenty of time to ask questions and discuss.

author: cheetahzd75
title: Useful and friendly reception staff
body: Spoke to Tanvir at reception this morning about not receiving my referral letter. He made sure to contact the GP whilst I was on the call, which I appreciate as sometimes I don’t think that queries are logged. He also helped me book an appointment and was useful and friendly. Thank you.

title: Struggling with econsult
body:
I know how under pressure this service is, however I find the econsult unusable.
I only seem to find NHS 111 or a list of illnesses and how I can help myself.  If there is a way to use it I have not found it today.

title: Just awful
body: After barely visiting my GP for the last 15 years I have had reason to over the last 6 months. I have been booked in with the wrong doctor, been spoken to by one particular receptionist in such a rude, sarcastic and dismissive way that I almost cried (I am not a crier, but when you are at a low ebb and feeling dreadful, some things can be the final straw), and not once have my prescriptions been completely right.  As far as my treatment itself goes, I feel like I am going around in circles. I don't feel listened to at all. You are rushed out of the room, talked over, one GP completely denied that I had told them something that I have brought up with them several times. I even thought of booking a private GP appointment just to see if someone else would at least really listen to what I am saying, but unfortunately, I cannot afford to. I have dealt with this surgery for many years, not for myself but for my children at various stages, and they absolutely were not like this ten or even five years ago. The service, from reception, dispensary and most of all the GPs themselves has taken such a nose dive over the last 4 or 5 years. Certainly pre-covid. As I said before, I don't feel I have been listened to and feel very unsupported by what used to be an excellent GP Practice. It's all tick boxes and forms, there is just no care at all.

title: Amazing
body: The speed and efficiency of service and caring attitude from the time I arrived at A&E to discharge after a procedure with an ongoing plan of support

title: Great Practice
body: I think this clinic is wonderful. The reception staff are always polite and helpful and the care I receive from the GP's to Nursing staff has always been top class. I called for a prescription at 4 pm on a Friday and I picked it up at 6.15 ! :really helped as I was able to collect my medication over the weekend. Thanks to everyone !

title: caring efficient staff
body: From being greeted at the door to leaving the building I was treated with dignity and efficiency. The day of my assessment was very quick and everything explained also the opportunity to ask any questions I had. The day of the operation I was very nervous but put at my ease and and could not believe how quick and painless the surgery was. I have no fears of having a second eye treated. Before the operation the surgeon took the time to come and speak to me and answer any questions I had which was appreciated. Within three days my records had been passed on to my optician and a  follow up appointment made. Thank you for a very efficient stress free and caring experience to all the staff at Edge Lane  in the opportunity arises I will have no hesitation in recommending your services

title: Excellent efficient service
body: First class, efficient friendly service. Excellent no hanging about, always on time, reception and staff great

title: Again, Great practice, Great Doctor
body: I called on Friday morning with persistent cough over 3 months and I was given an appointment within 3 hours to see a doctor. The doctor was really approachable, caring and listened to my concerns. the doctor was really supportive and arranged an x-ray straight away (very impressed) when everyone is under great stress in the caring sector. Big Thank You Barlow Medical Centre

title: Disabled Parking
body: Whilst collecting my prescription from automated machine I noticed a large commercial van was parked in the disabled space which meant anyone with mobility issues could not access the actual path.  No problem for me as I could walk across grass but wanted to make you aware.  Surgery was closed as it was a weekend.

title: Exceptional care
body: Had op as a day case. Can’t fault in any way. Efficient, caring, spotlessly clean. All you would want in that situation. Great!

title: Hopeless
body:
Never made it to the walk in centre. Information on opening hours totally inadequate. The paramedics thought it was open on a Sunday. The website said not. Nobody answered the phone, so had to do a return trip to Henley.

That a place like Reading doesn’t have a walk in centre 7 days a week and/or fails to promote it properly is pathetic. Would like to review its medical services but can’t.

title: Excellent care
body: I recently visited James cook for an operation. I was admitted to the women's surgical ward and from walking in the staff were amazing. I was very nervous and made me feel so relaxed. They explained the procedure thoroughly. Huge thank you to the anesthetist who knew I was a little worried and were chatting away to keep my mind off what was happening. The surgeon has done an amazing job and I don't even think I'll be left with a scar. Nobody wants to have an operation but if I was to ever need another I would always choose this hospital and wouldn't feel so anxious. The lady who looked after me on the ward after who had a cup of tea ready and waiting for me when I came round, you are the best. Just what I needed. Thank you everyone you were amazing I hope you understand what a fantastic job you are doing and how much the kindness you show means to people. I was so keen to check out and get back to the kids that I totally forgot to say a massive thank you. I hope this reaches you and you know how much I appreciate everything

title: Fantastic NHS as usual
body: I honestly can't thank the NHS for all their fantastic service during my 62 years, including during the pandemic. I've been there today for a tongue biopsy at 10.30 and was out by 11 and looked after by the most fantastic staff. Even this appointment was as a result to the NHS dentist who said I had a lump on my tongue in December 2022. I got an appointment before Christmas to check it out and a biopsy done by mid January. How on earth people keep saying they wait ages for an appointment is rubbish imo and how can anyone ask for more than I've just described. The NHS staff and service is not a problem but perhaps its senior management. Support the NHS, they save our lives and risked their own during the pandemic. Please praise them more often as they deserve it.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very efficient and effective
body:
Having read about issue and A&E it was with some trepidation that I came to Colchester.

The initial triage was by having to fill in a form in the porch. I saw even in the few minutes I was there it was obvious that this was needed as people were being referred elsewhere.

From then on I could not fault the service, after10 minutes in the waiting room I was in a triage room, where the appropriate tests took place and I was then moved to surgical assessment where I saw a consultant quickly, who after blood tests prescribed the actions that needed taking. I was treated and discharged around 5 hours of arriving.

Although I will not go into clinical details here my condition was given as potentially life changing/threatening and I was given the follow up information I needed.

At every stage I was treated with kindness, compassion and courtesy. I am am hard of hearing my wife accompanied me on every stage and the staff communicated through her as appropriate.

I could not fault the service I received on that day.


The only issue was that you held my details from when I was admitted as an emergency by ambulance many years ago and the A&E system did not transfer over my new address, despite the person on reception confirming the new address. As a result the discharge letter had the incorrect address.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent efficient service
body: First class, efficient friendly service. Excellent no hanging about, always on time, reception and staff great

title: first class experience
body: Beechwood Road is not my registered practice but I had to go there for a scan. From the minute I walked into this very clean and fresh smelling building I was treated with a friendly smile and 'good morning' from the receptionist, my appt was on time and the whole experience was brilliant. Staff were busy and bustling and there was a general feeling of positivity. This was honestly the best experience I have had a  GP surgery for years.

title: No support at all
body: Absolutely no support from this surgery. I have been trying to get pain relief for a chronic condition since before Xmas. Have found out today that the repeat has been stopped. Have previously tried calling surgery back but no one answers. Also have now been told I have no repeat for another ongoing medication for an autoimmune condition that is vital. This surgery used to be one of the best I have been with, I now view it as one of the worst. No communication and making appointments is at worst impossible and at best complicated. Even phone consultations are virtually impossible to obtain.

title: Good patient care
body: My mother was given an appointment to see the psychiatrist regarding test results. Unfortunately the consultant was on sick leave and we did not get the message the appointment had been changed. The staff were very helpful and after half an hour wait we saw a doctor, this saved us attending another appointment and delaying the diagnosis. I would like to thank the staff for their prompt action and helpfulness, and the doctor who did the consultation, much appreciated.

readBy.name: Tees, Esk and Wear Valleys NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great care, shocking food!!
body: Cant fault the care for the most part but considering I have now been an in patient for more than 2 weeks I feel the need to report the absolutely shocking food! I understand that this is now bought in? Well I'm sorry but what an utter waste of funds whoever this is bought in from needs to do better! Chicken in what can only be described as curdled cream sauce? Yes it had actually curdled! Recycled from Fridays leftnover pie filling im guessing! Porridge that is no more than runny cold milk with a few oats at the bottom of the bowl! Great choice options so long as you don't mind glorified microwave meals, pre packed salads and sandwiches. I actually have photos and videos as evidence of some of the utterly shocking "meals". How anyone is expected to get better when given this is beyond me! And to add insult to injury I've caught covid from the ward I'm on, been in isolation a week and only today has my bedding been changed! I understand the need for precautions but christ I'm no leper! Some clean bedding isn't a lot to ask for!

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: gone downhill practice
body: having my medication changed had to ring to make an appointment for blood test, after ringing and leaving my phone on loud speaker longest call 55 mins and spending 5 hours 10 mins total no answer. i used the call back 12 times no one ever called back phone calls were after 11 am and in afternoon similar with call back the period was 11 days.  Had to visit dispensary to pick tablets up while waiting heard people making appointments so on leaving asked to make appointment see a nurse receptionist replied  you have to ring up to make an appointment sorry you cannot do it here odd when we heard appointment's been taken earlier this was an afternoon. i have been with this practice from been born 74 years ago i have got to say it was a very good practice before the merger  lovely staff but who ever designed the phone system wants sacking there is no your number14 or so in the que  so as you have guessed i have gave up no appointment no blood test   thanks holderness health for your help not

title: Great practice
body:
I have been with this practice for 48years! The staff work very hard and are always polite. I went in November and was treated with respect!! Doctor was lovely.  
My view is manners and a smile cost Nothing.

title: Outstanding Service
body: The work ethic in this practice is amazing, receptionist are polite and welcoming,GPs are very welcoming, very attentive to the concerns shared by patients, keen to help resolve any concerns, and completing follow ups. Amazing service. Thank you.

title: What is it’s purpose when you get refused & sent…
body: Was advised by a nurse friend to visit this department due to illness on a Sunday , when I arrived I was turned away & told to go to A&E they only deal with injury’s yet website says otherwise. This didn’t first time, no wonder people are waiting 11 hours in A&E when these services are empty & turning people away

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service from all the team
body: I called the surgery in a very distressed state, the receptionist was excellent with me as I was very upset.  A doctor called me back within 15 mins and had me in the surgery within an hour to discuss my needs.  A very prompt referral to a member of the team for counselling and a prescription were issued to me.  Everyone who I dealt with regarding medication, counselling and even booking my appointments were excellent.  I sat on several occasions in the main waiting area, and listened to the challenges that the receptionists are constantly dealing with.  I was very impressed with everyone.  It is frustrating as a patient trying to get through on the phone, but just remember it is not the receptionists fault, every industry is dealing with staff shortages at the moment.  Thank you to the surgery.

title: Thank you
body: I’m not a patient of Haverhill family practice, but my father who passed away a few days before Christmas was.  In his last few hours, the doctor came to visit him and what a fantastic kind and caring man the doctor was.  He did his absolute best to make my dad comfortable and did his absolute best to look after and spend time listening to my mum. Whilst I guess this is just day to day stuff for a GP,  I’d like to use this review to remind the doctor of what a positive difference he made to my family.  (Name of the doctor not mentioned as it breaches review rules!)

title: Excellent practice
body: I have always had excellent professional service from this practice. I feel cared for and have never had problems with the service provided. The advise I received at short notice during the weekend to go straight to A&E, was critical to my health and appreciate the quick response.

title: Absolutely disappointed
body: I have been absolutely disappointed by the lack of urgency and series of errors regarding my mum's condition. I have been constantly chasing for the doctors to give me updates regarding her prognosis, and I have been chasing for appointments to be scheduled. Due to an error that was spotted by the doctor a few days later, we were phoned up to come to A&E and had to wait for 7 hours because they missed something on the CT Scan! She was due for surgery and the day prior, we were told to come to the hospital because they missed something again! There have been a series of errors which is disappointing and led to severe anxiety! I am appalled with the service.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Now an urgent care centre?
body: Every time I phone for an appointment I am asked for the reason and if the receptionist thinks the reason is not urgent she will not let me have an appointment.  My condition should not have to deteriorate until it is a matter of urgency before I can see a doctor as this is still a GP surgery and not an urgent care centre.

title: Care, compassion, professionalism at the walk-in…
body: As both my GP practice and the out of hours service were both closed, I had occasion to attend the walk-in clinic at the hospital. From the moment I walked in (feeling pretty poorly) I was treated with care, compassion and professionalism, from the receptionist taking my details to the nurse reading test results, diagnosing and ultimately prescribing. Thank you for the way I was treated on what was a busy afternoon for staff.

readBy.name: Hounslow and Richmond Community Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Amazing practice
body: I couldn’t recommend this surgery highly enough, incredible patient care, wonderful reception staff and a genuinely kind, swift, insightful GP - we get immediate appointments and truly excellent care. I can’t move house because I don’t want to have to leave them behind!

title: Outstanding staff and care
body: From day one I have come out from every consultation and treatment feeling like I was there only patient.  Everyone was so kind, respectful and caring in particular the staff in the Georgina unit are amazing. I have to go monthly for injections and they are always so very kind and reassuring. Thank you to them all

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: oppointments
body: since Covid 19 Impossible to get appointment and the online booking system doesn't work I tried phoning on several occasions and was placed in a que counting from 9th in the que to number 1 then you are  told something is wrong with the system after waiting one hour and 4min, and this happen to me on four occasions . the doctors are excellent but the reception staff don't phones and decides who see a doctor,

title: Great hard working practice
body: The doctors, nurses and staff in this practice have looked after my family and myself for over 30 years. I feel the need to inform you about their professionalism , compassion , caring and understanding. Thankyou nhs.

title: Excellent clinic
body:
I had my second cataract procedure at the Southampton clinic on 12th January.The staff were extremely professional and pleasant at all times. I had a slight delay with my second surgery but this was obviously for very good reasons. All went well as did my first operation at the end of November.
I am extremely happy with the results so far .
I would definitely recommend Spamedica if you are needing cataract surgery.Highly recommended

title: Waste of time
body: My partner called 111 after devoloping a pilonidal abcess which ruptured after waiting 24hrs for a call back advised to attend medway medocc at 6pm upon arrival we were told we didn't have an appointment and would have to wait 4 more hours this with an open wound and in an extremely painful location to sit and wait for 4 hours triage didn't even look at the wound we have already been told this would require surgery but that was not listened to just told to wait and see not acceptable to leave someone with an soon wound leading blood and puss into there underwear in a packed waiting room

title: Read this please
body:
The building was  opened in  October  2022 and so is brand new.  It is beautiful. I have been in a  few hospitals  on Merseyside  including  Arrow Park  ( some staff were really good but place dirty  food horrible. Very far away) This  new Royal Liverpool  is  incredible and  right  on my doorstep. As for the  staff, everyone  I met there nurses, cleaners  nursing assistants and  doctors, multi disciplinary teams 
 In fact everyone were  kind,, ccompassionate, hard working people who were not judgmental and did their best for absolutely  every patient. They clearly put  patients first (I have  been in hospitals  where this is not the case, although that is  rarely the nurses) And the food at the Royal  Liverpool is really, really  good!!
This amazing  hospital is the  number 1 reason I do want to move as well as the fact I  love Liverpool and (most of) the people who live here are really lovely.  My mum had worked  all around the world and she said that the nicest people  she had ever met were scousers!. 
I  think the Royal Liverpool  Hospital  is amazing and I  hope it  continues to be  so. Thank you all xx

title: Thorough check up
body: Referred by NHS 111. Shortness of breath, severe cough and chest pains. Attended by family transport. Triage was within 20 minutes of arrival then straight in for ECG, blood tests. Later saw a practioner nurse, chest X-ray and back to wait for results of further blood tests. Initial result showed anaemia. Had an iron infusion. Antibiotics also prescribed. Follow up appointment arranged for a week for a second iron infusion. Cannot fault the care given to me by all staff, from reception to leaving. Total time on the unit was about 5 hours. Obviously some of this time was waiting for bloods to be processed. On arrival the A and E unit was an exceptionally quiet Sunday morning about 1020. Many thanks to all the staff.

title: Not happy staff today
body:
Generally, level of care and service very good. Cheery. 
Today all seemed unhappy, i felt as if I was intruding, shouldn't  of been there.
Very basic , didn't really find out much what I went for totally. 
Possibly having an off day and pushed for resources,  sympathise, 
We have to be pleasant and polite, but the profession they are in is at least a caring service. But today just didn't feel like it.
Sorry.
Thanks for what I did receive

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Sensitive to my condition
body: As a severely immunocompromised patient I was impressed by how well the department handled my case. They made sure I was seen to straight away and was isolated. Staff, including doctors were very attentive and we're in touch with my own doctors from the word go

title: Fantastic Practice Nurse!
body: I took my elderly mum to see the practice nurse. What a great experience.  Very knowledgeable and caring. Took her time and really went out of way to ensure my mum got the best possible treatment and medication.  Obviously this surgery as a real asset here as other reviews echo my sentiment. Just hope the management appreciate the hard work and dedication of the staff.  Another shining example of some of the superb staff that work in the NHS. Thank you all!

title: Best practice I been to
body: The doctor made me feel so welcome and comfortable. And she understands what I'm going through. I want to get better and this is the place to do it

title: Excellent practice
body: My CBT sessions where very helpful and enlightening. My councillor was very professional. I had face to face and had to wait a little while longer but was so worth it. I highly recommend this practice.

title: Terrible practice
body:
there are several issues wrong with this surgery:
- understaffed and for some reason still trying to get more patients
- no appointments for their current patients
- use paramedics to see you, which means the paramedic walks out frequently to check with gps!
- never get an appointment with senior gps.
- reception staff are rude and show no compassion 
- frequently sent to a&e, and staff says there are no drs in the surgery, especially, afternoons
- you may have your appointment cancelled if there are too busy.
I don't recommend this surgery

title: Wel done NHS
body: When I contacted Castlegate Surgery after Christmas I received excellent and fast service with a quick referal to the Lister Hospital which resulted in a potentially worrying condition being sorted out within 9 days.

title: Prescription issues
body: Had a appointment today 15 January for a ear examination so was issued with a white prescription which was not acceptable at my local chemist only for use at the hospital but pharmacy is closed on Sunday so now have to go to my doctor's hoping to get the correct prescription as the hospital is twenty miles away. Apparently this has happened before so why is it continuing?

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Effective
body:
Wonderful, compassionate care shown to my 88 year old husband having had a severe allergic reaction. Treated with dignity. Even going to the trouble on the early hours of the morning to get antihistamines from All night supermarket.
Wonderful continued help the next day by Acct Team arranged as well. These guys should be paid a proper decent wage. I have never come across an unhelpful paramedic.

title: Wonderful care
body:
I would like to thank all the staff for looking after Trevor so well over 3 months.  He really loved being up there and still remembers and speaks of you. He has now settled at Meadowbrook and receiving excellent ongoing care. My journey time has been considerably reduced.
Thanks Gaile

title: Gone from excellent to awful
body: Recommended Livi to my husband having had a positive experience. His appointment was delayed so, by the time the doctor called we were in the car with a poor signal. She arranged a new call for 3pm, which was cancelled at 2.50. He has since spent 55 mins on hold trying to speak to their customer service. It’s hard enough to speak to a doctor without the virtual version going to pot as well. Literally patients are out of options, it’s no wonder A&E is clogged up

title: Amazing friendly and kid and considerate
body: My daughter who is just 17 years old came into the colonoscopy department today and the lady’s in this department went over and beyond for her. She has said it made it so much easier having doctors and nurses and other workers in the department that talk and be happy around them at such a awful worrisome time , thankyou so much to all of you we hope you get this message

title: Caring and efficient
body: I attended the walk in after a fall hurting my wrist. The triage nurse was amazing giving me pain relief and sorting a form for an xray. I was xrayed and then called in to another nurse who explained I had fratured my wrist and needed it to be plastered which she did. She helped fit a sling gave me aftercare information and referred me to the fracture clinic. Everyone was so caring and I was in and out in just over an hour. Thank you

author: pilingsrk57
title: Really positive physio appointment
body:
I attended a physio appointment this week after been referred by my GP and my experience was very very good. The physio was on time, extremely thorough in all the info she gave me when she examined me, and within 24 hours of seeing her, she had sent me exercises for me to do which she felt would help me, so I was very pleased. My appointment was with physiotherapy at Bideford Community Hospital, in North Devon.  
I’ve never had a bad experience on the NHS personally.  
My physio was a lady called Jenna, she was very very pleasant and calm and efficient. She came over very efficiently and she was very thorough in her examination. The other thing that was very positive was that I could have an open appointment, where I can go back if I need to until some time in Feb I think. I can’t ask for anymore really, having an open appointment is great. All of the people that I have seen in the NHS are doing the very best they can. I’m pleased with what I received with regards to my appointment.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust
Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

author: Ilona
title: No help received & very disappointed
body:
I called for ambulance Thursday early morning with very high blood pressure (220/110 ) and very intense pain in my chest and my left side.  
The ambulance never arrived, so I went to A&E myself. I was there 12 hours. I had some tests done however I was not told what was wrong with me. I asked why my blood pressure jumped so high because I never had so high blood pressure. The nurse said it is because I have very high cholesterol but I did not received any medication to lower my cholesterol. I received the prescription for medication for high blood pressure and they said I can leave and go home, I went to buy my prescription and they told me the medication I have been prescribed was no longer available.  
I was not given any advice and I do not know that to do moving forward.  
I have gone to my GP however they do not want give me any medication to lower my cholesterol. They said I need to wait 2 weeks and then book appointment to do the blood test. I am still weak and feel pain in my left side and I am left without help.  
When I do not mind spending so much time waiting, I understand the NHS is overwhelmed, I am really upset I did not receive help in this serious situation. I am in my early fifties and a single mum, I am upset and scared as do not know what to do and where to seek help.

author: Dmcc
title: Antibiotics prescribed by text
body:
I phoned my surgery after seeing blood in my urine for 2 days, expecting a call from a GP. What I got was a text message saying that I could collect a prescription for antibiotics for a urinary infection from my pharmacy. If there was no improvement in 7 days I should contact the surgery again.  
How many more serious conditions can result in blood in your pee? Why was there no check for antibiotic tolerance? So my relationship with my GP and their assessment of what medication I need doesn't even seem to require a phone call any more, just a text.

author: Meat
title: Econsult
body:
I also tried for 20mins to navigate my way through the questions. I was referred back to reception for a serious matter.  
But reception would not make an appointment without the econsult form.  
In the end I lied about my symptoms to get the system to accept me.  
I think econsult is dangerous for patients

author: lovesz95
title: Poor experience in ENT
body:
I was subject to an attack which left me with a broken nose.  
I was referred to Fulwood Hall and was promised many things by the ENT surgeon - None of which happened. Instead, I was left with a disfigured face and have lost so much confidence to the point it has taken over my life.  
I was recently told that Fulwood would foot the bill for an independent opinion, to which I was over the moon at. However, I was recently told that that review was cancelled over 3 months prior and Fulwood failed to notify me that this independent review would not be taking place at all.  
I emailed Fulwood Hall/Ramsay Health Care & also rang to no avail - All correspondence has been ignored completely.  
I found it super unprofessional and quite cruel for Fulwood Hall to give me some hope that this could be resolved and that I could finally regain my confidence, to completely cancel the life changing referral with no explanation.  
To conclude this, I am disgusted that an health care provider would do this to someone whom has been affected a great deal already by their establishment.

author: serpensxh88
title: Second injection
body:
Please I feel that you wasted my time, which every day is gold plated for me.  
I was informed by one of your phone staff that I could have the covid jab here. When I arrived I waited 1/2hr to be told I could not have the vaccine as it was not astrazeneca.

author: annsr47
title: Basic personal care was not provided on any level
body:
A family member was admitted to ward 8b from Accident and Emergency. He was admitted for ARLD and was a patient on the ward for 10 days before family members were aware due to us contacting hospital switchboard.  
Upon visiting relative in the ward he was seen to be wearing hospital gown and the same underwear he was admitted wearing 10 days previous. He had not been provided with any toiletries or toothbrush during this time, despite asking multiple members of staff within the ward during the time, he advised that he felt he was bothering people with something that wasn't important as they were busy caring for others.  
He had not been able to access his mobile phone to contact relatives as he had no charger and was advised one would be given, but by day 10 this had not occurred. Basic personal care was not provided on any level. As a nurse within the service, I myself am aware of the pressures currently on the service, but cannot see how this would directly impact basic nursing care being provided by members of staff within the ward.  
Upon asking to speak to staff within the ward, we were advised there was no one available, despite multiple staff being seated at the nursing station.

title: Great practice
body: I was extremely amazed at the MRI scan experience I had. The machine was a lot quicker and quieter then previous MRI machines I have been in. The room was also calming, the assistants were very welcoming and nice. And the practice was very clean

title: Everything good about the NHS.
body:
I didn't even know that Falmouth Health Centre existed (just behind the hospital).  It was clean, staff were friendly and helpful (it's not exactly a great time to work in the NHS) and I felt I'd received good, knowledgeable 'care' during my podiatry appointment.

I happened to speak with someone (boiler engineer) the next day who was also complimentary about their visit with a sick child.

I appreciate our NHS staff - it's been a difficult few years and I can only hope it gets better.

title: Wonderful Hospital and exceptional staff
body: From the front reception desk to the medical staff the professionalism and caring of all the people I met was second to none. They put you at ease and kept you informed every step of the way.

title: Excellent Medical Practitioner
body: I phoned late one afternoon because of painful symptoms. I was called back within an hour by the Advanced Medical Practitioner.  They ascertained the problem and organised a prescription to be immediately sent to my pharmacy, and for me to drop a sample at the health centre. My symptoms improved after 2 days. I spoke to them again after 5 days to review the situation. I was very impressed by their expertise and efficiency.

title: the advice offered was extremely useful and…
body: I first accessed the service 7 years ago, at a time when I was experiencing a very traumatic and difficult time. I was getting to the point of being so anxious and this was interspersed with depression, I couldn’t calm down on my own and my normal coping strategies were not working.   My GP suggested a referral to MindMatters.  I was open to the idea and straight away I submitted an onlIne referral to MindMatters, and I have never looked back.

title: Excellent Care
body: I recently had to attend Estuary View Emergency Department following an episode.From the moment we entered the unit we were shown real care, kindness and a sense of urgency. Every many of staff was very professional and reassuring. Thank you.

title: Excellent  kind efficient care from Day ward 6b
body: Such kindly and reassuring nurses and practitioners on the day ward 6b who were so friendly and helpful and kind to both my partner and myself and totally reassuring with efficient treatment and no sign of being rushed. they spoke to everyone with genuine care and kindness. Ensured the doctor saw us, who was also very kind and gave us time despite having had a busy surgical afternoon, to reassure us and offer us the continuing commitment to resolution of problem. Very many thanks it so much appreciated at an upsetting time.

title: Great experience
body: I referred myself to mind matter due to pregnancy depression. They got back to me and offered me sessions quite quickly. I was able to have someone guiding me throughout my pregnancy. Having someone I can talk to, share my anxiety and feel comfortable with is very helpful. My baby is due in a month and thanks to my therapist I’m feeling much much better than I was before. Highly recommended.

title: Exceptional Care
body: My husband was admitted to the Clinical Decisions Unit Ward at The Friarage with Pneumonia after attending the Urgent Care Unit. The care he received immediately on being seen by the staff was excellent and he was given the medication needed within a short time. All the staff were superb and we cannot fault the care he received from everyone. Thank You.

title: Amazing service
body: I would like to thank each member of staff from both Mattishall and Lenwade surgery! The service provided is always above and beyond for both myself and my children. With the ongoing pressures within the NHS the staff are always trying their best and will try to solve any issues that arise to the best of their ability! You provide a fantastic service- thank you

title: The Staff are Brilliant
body: Came on a dermatology referral today and I just wanted to say a big thank you to all the staff.  From the reception staff, to the doctor, to the staff that took photos, and to the nurses who carried out a minor biopsy.  Everyone was incredibly kind, friendly and made the whole process seamless.  Your work is very much appreciated.  Thank you.

title: No issues, friendly and efficient
body:
I moved to this area over a year ago and registered with Spilsby, my nearest practice. I'm not a "regular" at the surgery but all interactions and visits here have been faultless.
Direct contact when needed either by phone or in person has been pleasant and efficient.

title: Parking charges disgraceful
body: I attended for a body xray tje service bu safe was great as I was very anxious about posse health complication following a double organ transplant.  Today I received a parking fine at no time when I arrived did I see it  clearly displayed I needed to register at reception nor was it mentioned.  I have been using health services and never apart from attending hospital had to register my parking at a gps.  As if I wasn't worried enough now face a £100 fine or so generous of them only £60 if I pay before 26. Dec.  As if I don't have enough to worry about.  I am throughly disgusted.  Why can't reception staff mention the parking this wS my first visit.  Completly upset and disappointed.

title: Very good service
body: I felt I was listened to by the reception staff and they acted quickly to provide me with an appointment.  I was very pleased with the amount of information the GP gave me, and put my mind at rest.

title: Good experience til today.
body: My partner had been seen today (13/01/23) and the mid wife was shocking. Mid wife was very rude when my partner mentioned she was tired to be hearing back ‘Oh you wait til babys here’ disgusting attitude to have and not professional, absolutely awful. Then when she mentioned about how long she can to over, she replied ‘well they won’t injuice (apologies for spelling) you just because you’re tired’ again another disgusting comment/remark by the mid wife, if i was there i would not of allowed her to be spoken to like that and refused the service. My partner is 24 years old, we’re having our first child and she’s under a load of emotions and to hear this from her is awful from the mid wife. Happy to call to discuss.

title: Good practice
body: The 2 nurses were lovely and friendly made me feel at ease nothing was to much trouble and I didn’t feel rushed was nice seeing a actual person

title: Clean Hospital - Great Friendly Service
body: An absolute godsend for people not close to Treliske, a shame it's not 24h. Hopefully it'll get the investment and extra staff it deserves in the future. My experience - in the Injury's unit - The staff were very friendly and caring. Thank You !

title: care for mother
body: i rang 111 on 7 Jan due to my elderly mother having a swelling on  her back in area of kidney due to an inoperable staghorn kidney stone due to her fragile condition for which she has to permanently take antibiotics. the last time this ocurred the swelling was drained off fairly quickly, 111 arranged, via doctor, to get us a payed cab as they were very concerned and suggested she get treatment asap. we arrived at 10:30 am and never left until late in evening, we were just eventually given more antibiotics as after scans e.t.c. we were told it was just a ut infection. Her condition has not improved or her mental state and our regular doctor has suggested we return to hospital but i doubt we will use Mayday, he was also wondering why we were not treated in Urology given her medical condition?

title: Slow/Poor Communication
body: I had been with this medical centre for about 2 years. Every single time I tried to ring to make an appointment it would ring for an extremely long time, even if I was 'next in the queue'. One time when the staff picked up after the long wait, she was very rude and dismissive of the questions I had. Not the nicest experience unfortunately.

title: Wonderful service
body: I had to bring my elderly mother to the A&E department on 15.1.23 I was so impressed with the care and kindness shown to her alongside the very careful and thorough medical attention she received. Many thanks to you all.

title: Nurses fantastic
body:
Nurse I saw today is always lovely. Personable, kind and caring. 
And talks through all the process.

title: Cancel urgent referral no reason
body:
Urgent referral by GP in May 2022. Appointment letter dated Nov 18th received mid December for appointment Jan. 20, 2023.
Called Jan.16, 2023 to be told appointment cancelled. No reason given. No new appointment. So much for "urgent" referrals. No GP appt available for 4 weeks! Hate to think what happens if not urgent.

title: Urgent treatment care
body: Today I went to urgent care in central Middlesex Hospital as advised by 111 for my 4 years old boy.  He has very bad allergy all over body.I was waiting for 5 hours , when I went to reception to ask how long for my number, she said I don’t know.  Later one nurse came out from doctor and said we have one doctor only and don’t know how long you have to wait for doctor but I already waited more than 5 years ,  I left urgent treatment care and said I came as per 111 doctor advised.  I was really upset and insufficient services from Urgent care treatment.  Extremely disappointed

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Excellent advice
body:
There may well be intense pressure on everyone's available time at the moment, but I have found this surgery to provide immediate appointments where necessary and the advice kind, extremely informative and helpful.  I now understand the reasons behind my symptoms and can get on with life accordingly.

Do disregard reviews that are clearly from those who expect immediate responses in all circumstances. It is not the fault of the practice that there are sicker people that need help first, and resources are not limitless unless you are prepared to pay for them.

title: The most greatest Practice
body: The staff here is the most helpful people, if you have any English barrels in Springfield you will found Spanish speakers which is amazing!

author: Weebies86
title: I asked how long the waiting list was, to be told over 3 years!
body:
I had received a letter stating my toddler was on a waiting list to be seen by the neurodevelopmental service for children & young people but they have a very long wait. I thought ok, covid catch up appointments, NHS in crisis and things could effect this like the possibility of strike action.  
I phoned up the service and spoke to a very nice lady, this is not a complaint regarding anyone I spoke to, I asked how long the waiting list was to be told over 3 years, thought I had miss heard her, 3 years.  
How can I support my son and help him when we have no idea what we should be doing to help him. In years he could have plenty support in those 3 year, he could be worse in 3 years or he could also be better with support. According to the government website an appointment should be made within 4 weeks?  
The National Neurodevelopmental Specification sits along the NHS Scotland National Service Specification for Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services (CAMHS) and the same principles underpin both specifications.Standard 1: High Quality Care and Support that Is Right for Me1.2 Offer a first appointment to all children and young people who have been identified (e.g. by a GP, a Named Person or a Children's Planning meeting) as needing a neurodevelopmental assessment. This first appointment should be as soon as possible and no later than 4 weeks from identification of need.Can someone tell me why this isn’t being followed? I am sure I am not the only parent in Lanarkshire with this issue.

title: Cancelled again and again and again and again
body: Its difficult to review this service positively as it keeps getting cancelled a week before the surgery and rebooked 3 months later. Ive had over 6 appointments cancelled now. Rebooked in oct , cancelled in Nov but we’re now in Jan and its not been rebooked. Looks like i dont matter.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor communications
body: I am extremely disappointed with the poor communications from this department. Trying to get to speak with someone is nigh impossible. Thank goodness for the PALS department. All the phones redivert to 01438 284060 which isn't manned and voicemails not being picked up or acted upon. This number was also given as an emergency line post biopsy. Considering my referral was under the 2 week wait and results are late and overdue, talking to someone would have helped reduce anxiety. Such poor systems of communications - the absolute fundamental in healthcare services.

title: Fantastic service.
body: I was admitted to the A and E Department in the RBH on Saturday Evening c.7pm. In the course of 4 hours, I had a blood test, ECG test, blood pressure test and an Xray. The service I got from all the staff could not have been better. The doctor on duty was first class and extremely helpful.

title: Occupational therapy
body:
I was advised 5 days ago that there was no treatment available for my condition . I was also advised that occ . health need to assess my needs before I can go home.
The major problem is that it is impossible to contact this department to by phone or email to discuss the matter. It is left to when this department decides to turn up.
